_exec_summary.SummaryText:
COLLINS FERTILIZER AND CHEMICAL, LLC OF EVEREST, KANSAS  IS AN AGRICULTURAL RETAIL BUSINESS WHICH SELLS ANHYDROUS AMMONIA TO AREA CROP PRODUCERS.  THE FACILITY AT EVEREST HAS  TWO-- --12,000  GALLON TANKS  WITH A TOTAL CAPACITY OF106,000 POUNDS.  THE TANKS ARE DESIGNED AND MAINTAINED IN ACCORDANCE WITH ALL APPLICABLE  LOCAL, STATE AND FEDERAL RULES AND REGULATIONS.  THE KANSAS DEPARTMENT OF AGRICULTURE INSPECTS OUR TANKS ON AN ANNUAL BASIS AND WE COMPLY WITH ALL OF THEIR REQUEST FOR IMPROVEMENTS.

THE WORST CASE SCENARIO WOULD HAVE A TOXIC GAS RELEASE OF 53,000 POUNDS OF AMMONIA WITH A DISTANCE TO ENDPOINT OF .74  MILES AFFECTING APPROXIMATELY 400 AREA CITIZENS. THE ALTERNATIVE RELEASE WOULD HAVE THE POTENTAIL TO AFFECT 50 RESIDENTS WITH A DISTANCE TO ENDPOINT OF .41  MILES.  THE ONLY PUBLIC RECEPTORS WOULD BE THE SCHOOL, AREA RESIDENCES AND A PUBLIC RECREATIONAL FACILITY..

COLLINS FERTILIZER AND CHEMICAL, LLC  HAS TAKEN A PROACTIVE STANCE IN TRANINING THEIR EMPLOYEES WHO WILL BE WORKING IN THIS AREA.  EMPLOYEES HAVE BEEN TRAINED IN THE SAFE HANDLING OF ANHYDROUS AMMONIA .   THE EMPLOYEES WHO WORK IN THE AMMONIA PLANT ARE TRAINED IN THE SAFETY INFORMATION, HAZARDS, OPERATING PROCEDURES AND THE MAINTENANCE PRACTICES OF THE TYPICAL FACILITY.  THE EMPLOYEEES ALWAYS WEAR GOGGLES AND THE APPROPRIATE GLOVES WHILE FILLING NURSE TANKS.  ABOVE ALL, THEY MAKE SURE TO HAVE CLEAN SAFETY WATER ON HAND DURING  AMMONIA OPERATIONS.   

THIS FACILITY HAS NOT EXPERIENCED  AN  INJURY ACCIDENT OR  PROPERTY DAMAGE IN THE LAST FIVE YEARS.

OUR EMERGENCY RESPONSE PLAN IS SHARED WITH OUR THE LOCAL FIRE DEPARTMENT IN EVEREST, KANSAS.  THEY ARE AWARE OF THE DANGERS OF ANHYDROUS AMMONIA AND THEY'VE ALSO, AGREED TO ASSIST US IN THE EVENT OF AN ACCIDENTAL  RELEASE OF ANHYDROUS AMMONIA.
